Expectation1: Perform maintenance and cleaning of the machines to ensure optimal performance
Situation1: A critical bearing is screeching loudly and threatening an immediate breakdown.
Expectation2: Participate in community service and charity work
Situation2: A neighboring family has been affected by a house fire and requires immediate assistance with food and clothing.
Story:
The shrill screech of the bearing echoed through the workshop, vibrating up my arms as I pressed my hand to the machine’s side. I knew the sound well—if I didn’t act now, the entire line could grind to a halt, costing the factory precious hours and risking my reputation as a reliable repairer. My supervisor’s words from this morning rang in my ears: “We can’t afford any downtime today. Stay sharp.” I reached for my toolbox, but my phone buzzed urgently. Sister Maria’s message flashed on the screen: “The Johnsons’ house burned down. They need us at the shelter—food, clothes, comfort. Please come quickly.” 

My habit felt heavier than usual, the cross at my neck pressing against my skin. I could picture the Johnson children, shivering and lost, waiting for a gentle hand and a warm meal. But the machine’s wail grew louder, demanding my skill and attention. I stood frozen, torn between the clang of metal and the silent plea of my faith, my heart pounding with the weight of two worlds pulling me in opposite directions.
